intro: Metalasia serrata, commonly known as the serrated metalasia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers that are typically arranged in clusters. Its leaves are usually opposite and have serrated edges, giving it its common name. Metalasia serrata is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
